chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: As David said, I've been at this for a long time.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: I am not a medical doctor, but I've probably learned enough medicine to be able to play

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: one on television over the years.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And actually, that's relevant to today's lecture, because today's lecture is really

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: trying to set the scene for you to say, well, what are the kinds of problems that doctors

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: are interested in by looking at what is it that they do?

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: So that's our goal for today.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: So what we're going to do today is to talk about, in a very general way, what are the

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: goals of health care?

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: So how many of you are doctors?

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: A couple.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: Great.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: OK.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: So fix me when I blow it.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: All right?

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: Please feel free to interrupt.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: So that's going to be my first task.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And then the second one is going to be, what are the things that people actually do in

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: order to try to achieve these goals?

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: What is the practice of medicine like?

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: What is the process that generates the data that we're going to be using to learn from?

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And then I can't resist talking a little bit about paying for health care at the end of

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: the lecture, because a lot of the problems that come up and a lot of the interest that

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: people show in doing the kind of analysis we're talking about, in fact, is motivated

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: by money.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: They want to be able to save money or spend less money or something like that.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: So it's important to know that.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: OK.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: Medicine's been around for a long time.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: I think from probably the earliest of recorded history, there are discussions of people wondering

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: what the cause of disease is, how to cure it.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: They came up with some fairly cockamamie theories, because they didn't have a lot of scientific

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: modern approaches to it.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: For example, this is a photo on the left of a shaman, I think from a Canadian Indian tribe,

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: who's working on the boy lying there who's sick.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And this shaman would use his knowledge of experience that he'd had with other patients.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: They did know a lot about medicinal plants.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: They knew something about how to care for injuries and things like that.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And so this was an effective form of health care.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: Not much record keeping.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: You don't see electronic medical record system in that scene.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: On the right is a modern shaman practicing at one of the New York area hospitals.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And so there are traditional cultures in which that sort of hands-on interaction with the

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: healer is considered a very important part of the practice of medicine.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And if you listen to futurists, doctors talking about what medicine is likely to be like,

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: they emphasize the fact that the role of a healer is not just to be a good automaton

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: who figures out the right things, but is to persuade a patient to trust him to do the

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: things that he or she is suggesting to the patient.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And there are a lot of placebo effects that we know from lots and lots of experiments

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: that say that if you think you're going to get better, you are going to get better on

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: average.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: No guarantees.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: Okay.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: Now modern medicine actually looks more like this.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: So this is an intensive care unit.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And what you see is a patient who has got all kinds of electrical leads and tubes and

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: things going into him and is surrounded by tons and tons of equipment, which is monitoring

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: him and perhaps keeping him alive.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And so this is the high-tech medicine that we think of as the contemporary version of

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: clinical care.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: Well, you might say, okay, what does it mean to be healthy?

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: If the goal of medicine is to make people or keep people healthy, what is health?

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: So we turn to the World Health Organization, and they have this lovely, very comprehensive

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: notion of the definition of health, a state of complete physical, mental, and social well-being,

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: not merely the absence of disease or infirmity.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And then they categorize this and they say, well, there's physical health, there's mental

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: health, and there's social health.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: Social health is especially hard to measure, and I'll come back to that in a little while.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: So what's easiest to measure is how long people live.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And so we've had data on survival analysis for a long time.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And this is kind of shocking.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: If you look here, this lower curve is from around 1800.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And what it shows you is that if you lived in India around 1800, your life expectancy

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: was about 25 years.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: That's not very good.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And if you lived in the richest countries, which in those days were typically European,

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: in Belgium, your life expectancy was way up there at 40 years.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: How many of you knew that?

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: Okay, good.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: I didn't until I started looking at this.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: Now by 1950, which is not that long ago, it was like 69 years ago, in Norway, your expectation

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: was that you'd live into your early 70s, and in the US that you would live into your late

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: 60s on average.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: There was still a huge cliff where if you lived in Bhutan or Somalia or something, you

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: were still down around 30.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: Today, well in 2012, we're doing a lot better.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And the thing that's striking is not only that the people who were doing well have gotten

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: better, but that a lot of the people who were doing very poorly have also gotten better.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And so we're now up, you know, India remember was at 25 years of life expectancy, and now

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: it's in the high 60s.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: Now of course these are averages, and so individuals vary a lot, but it's kind of interesting.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: So if you look at the numbers, you see that even on a shorter term, there are big changes.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: So for example, if you're a male living in Rwanda, which is among the worst places in

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: terms of life expectancy, your life expectancy if you're born today is about 62 and a half

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: years.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: If you were born in 2001, it was only 38 years.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: Now what was going on in Rwanda in 2001?

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: Genocide.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: Yeah, they were killing each other.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: So that's sort of an exceptional situation.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And that's gotten much better because they've stopped killing each other as genocidal attacks

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: between the Hutu and the Tutsi, I think, if I remember right.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: What about South Africa?

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: What was going on in South Africa in 2001?

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: I'm not sure I heard you.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: Failure to address the HIV crisis.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: Yes, the government at the time was claiming that HIV was not the cause of AIDS, and therefore

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: there was no point in controlling HIV infections because AIDS was caused by something else.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: Pretty crazy.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: So that was terrible, and they've gotten much better at it.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: So that's what you tend to see in a lot of African countries.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And what you also see is that there has really been improvement everywhere.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: So in the US, we went from males expected to live 74 years to almost 78 years.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: So about a four-year increase in life expectancy over a period of just 17 years.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: You women, by the way, are going to outlive us men on average.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: There's some biological thing that seems to work that way.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: So a typical way that people look at survival of a population is to say, well, given a cohort

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: of people born at some instant zero, what fraction of them are still alive after a certain

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: period of time?

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And what you see is that, of course, 2031, we haven't reached yet.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And so these are projections based on theoretical extrapolations of actual data.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: But the older data is real.

chunks.title: Lecture 2 Overview of Clinical Care
chunks.text: And what you see is that from 1851 to 2011, let's say, these projections are real.
